thread.title: Chapecoense win first match since Colombian air tragedy with 2-1 win over Inter de Lages in front of emotional crowd
thread.title_full: Chapecoense win first match since Colombian air tragedy with 2-1 win over Inter de Lages in front of emotional crowd

author: tsheen
title: Chapecoense win first match since Colombian air tragedy with 2-1 win over Inter de Lages in front of emotional crowd
text:
EFL CHAPE VICTORY Chapecoense win first match since Colombian air tragedy with 2-1 win over Inter de Lages in front of emotional crowd 
Niltinho and Wellington Paulista on target as Chape win first league game of the season By TOM SHEEN Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments CHAPECOENSE won their first game since the Colombian air tragedy killed 19 players and their former coach in November. 
The 2-1 victory over Inter de Lages was met with emotional scenes in the stands at the Arena Conda. O primeiro gol oficial da Chapecoense em 2017!Gol: Niltinho ⚽️ 3 Niltinho celebrates the opener for Chapecoense after the club beat Inder de Lages in their first league game of the season 
The Brazilian club has had to bring in an entirely new playing staff for the new season – but managed to beat win their first league game of the season. 
Niltinho and Wellington Paulista scored to give Vagner Mancini’s team a winning start to the new Catarinense season. Reuters Chapecoense fans hold up a tribute in their first game last week Getty Images The Colombia air tragedy killed 71 people – including 19 Chapecoense players and the manager 
The club have had to completely rebuild after the tragic plane crash in November in Colombia. 
The first-team squad, as well as coaches and backroom staff and journalists, were travelling to Medellin for the first leg of the Copa Sudamerica final. Chapecoense plane tragedy survivor Jackson Follmann lifts the Copa Sudamericana trophy RELATED STORIES FOOTBALL UNITES Chapecoense survivors take to the pitch as Brazil and Colombia put aside rivalry in special international friendly in Rio de Janeiro to raise money for families of plane crash victims 'It has a bigger meaning' Chapecoense's new keeper Artur Moraes reveals how club and fans are rebuilding after plane tragedy more to come New Chapecoense signing Artur Moraes describes life at club and emotion in dressing room WOUNDED WARRIORS Emotional Chapecoense survivors hoist aloft Copa Sudamericana trophy while families of victims mourn as Brazilian club return to the pitch for first game since plane crash Hero's welcome Chapecoense train in front of fans at stadium for first time since plane disaster as crowd cheer on new signings and survivor Alan Ruschel Back on track Chapecoense survivor Helio Neto begins gruelling physiotherapy as rest of squad train ahead of first game since tragedy Back in business Chapecoense put tragedy behind them as their newly-assembled squad train ahead of first game of season on Saturday READY TO GO Chapecoense take squad of 30 into first match since air crash thanks to generosity of 'rivals' 
The plane crashed as it approached the city, killing 71 people in total. 
Just three players survived the crash - the club was later awarded the Copa Sudamericana in tribute with Colombian side Atletico Nacional opting not to play. 
The club had offers from players all over South America to play for them. 
Of the 28 players who make up Chape's squad, only 11 are not on loan. Brazil beat Colombia 1-0 in a friendly match for the Chapecoense plane crash victims
